availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Chilton (1st ky cavalry regiment)

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James L. Chilton and Martha Chilton. Married to Sarah J. Pickens Chilton in Russell County, Kentucky, on December 13, 1865. Sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from July 27, 1861, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 10-11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, Etown, p. 109.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Russell County Marriages, Film #000594313, p. 492-93.
